intro: Hieracium weitfeldense, commonly known as the Weitfeld hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and basal rosette of leaves. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium weitfeldense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
